Present value for each uptake cohort and calculation time

Source: R/oop.R
sum_by_coh.Rd

Calculates the sum of the Present Value by uptake cohort (j) and time at which the calculation is performed (tzero input to dynpv())

Usage

sum_by_coh(df)

Arguments

df

Tibble of class "dynpv" created by dynpv() or futurepv()

Value

A number or tibble

Details

The Present Value of a cashflow \(p_k\) for the \(u_j\) patients who began treatment at time \(j\) and who are in their \(k\)th timestep of treatment is as follows $$PV(j,k,l) = u_j \cdot p_k \cdot R_{j+k+l-1} \cdot (1+i)^{2-j-k}$$ where \(i\) is the risk-free discount rate per timestep, \(p_k\) is the cashflow amount in today’s money, and \(p_k \cdot R_{j+k+l-1}\) is the nominal amount of the cashflow at the time it is incurred, allowing for an offset of \(l = tzero\).

This method returns \(\sum_{k=1}^{T-j+1} PV(j,k,l)\) for each value of \(j\) and \(l\), where \(T\) is the time horizon of the calculation.

See also

dynpv(), futurepv()
